thread.title: Industry man charged in Aliquippa bank robbery
thread.title_full: Industry man charged in Aliquippa bank robbery

author: Kirstin Kennedy Calkins Media.
title: Industry man charged in Aliquippa bank robbery
text:
Citizens Bank in Aliquippa robbed 
Police have made an arrest in the August robbery of Citizens Bank in Aliquippa. Posted: Wednesday, October 14, 2015 9:00 pm Industry man charged in Aliquippa bank robbery By Kirstin Kennedy Calkins Media. EllwoodCityLedger.com | 0 comments 
ALIQUIPPA -- City police have made an arrest in an August bank robbery that prompted the lockdown of an elementary school. 
According to a police report, John J. Deem Jr., 24, was identified through video surveillance as the suspect in the robbery of Citizens Bank, 907 22nd St., on Aug. 26. 
Police said Deem entered the bank at 2:50 p.m. and presented a note to a teller demanding money and threatening to shoot if authorities were notified. Deem reached over the counter and took money from the teller's hands and then ran out the door, police said. 
According to the report, officers followed Deem's path and found his hat, sunglasses, sweatshirt and backpack. Police said they also found the note he showed to the bank teller next to a garbage can. 
Through their investigation, officers identified Deem, police said. According to the report, he admitted to the robbery. 
Aliquippa Elementary School briefly went on lockdown Aug. 26 after the robbery. Police said it was done as a precaution. 
Deem, of 191 Russell Hill Road, Industry, has been charged by Aliquippa police with robbery, making terroristic threats, theft and receiving stolen property. He was taken to the Beaver County Jail on Oct. 7 on $75,000 bond. 
Deem is awaiting an Oct. 19 preliminary hearing.
